New Records: This defeat marked the 14th largest margin of loss in the history of ODI World Cups.
It became England's most substantial defeat in the ODI World Cup, surpassing their previous largest loss of 202 runs against India in the 1975 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen scored a remarkable century with 109 runs off 67 balls.
Marco Jansen contributed significantly with an unbeaten 75 runs off 42 balls.
Reece Topley was England's most successful bowler with figures of 3 for 88.
Gerald Coetzee claimed three wickets for 35 runs in just four overs.
South Africa finished with a total of 399 runs for 7 wickets.
England could only muster 170 runs in 22 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram praised the team's all-round performance and expressed satisfaction with their strategy of batting first.
England captain Jos Buttler expressed disappointment over the defeat and acknowledged that many things did not go as planned.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's victory consolidated their position as the third-ranked team in the World Cup 2023 points table with a net run rate of +2.21.
England's defeat caused them to plummet to the ninth position in the points table, tied with Afghanistan in terms of points and carrying a net run rate of -1.25.
